Which leads me to something that I noticed while playing as an alien: They will destroy your harvestors, START to build an extractor, and then never finish it, leading to a very, very frustraiting bug: a hologram will just sit there, blocking you from building a harvestor, but indestructible (I got out of the hive, attacked it, but to no avail; every time it got close to being destroyed, a huge cloud of dust appeared and it would be back to the same health I found it at, about 1/4th full). Also, while playing a gorge, I blocked off an entrance to a room with clots. The marines seemed to not understand that they could destroy them, and just kept walking into them like they weren't there. This kept the hive alive for a long, long time, until I got bored and moved the clots somewhere else, and the entire marines team ran into the room immidiately.Mechanics: They seem fine, but I have one annoying nitpick: Scrolling down while your a marine goes to the melee weapon immidiately then your secondary weapon... Scrolling up goes to your secondary weapon, then your melee weapon... That makes no sense to me, and I'll probably never get used to that.For right now, I cannot reccomend this game. It seems like fun if you've played a lot of it and have gotten pretty good, but if you're starting out, it ends up being really frustraiting and unplayable. You can't really learn much while on multiplayer (especially when you want to try out being a commander, you'll get immidiately booted), and bots will make your worse at the game. (Or feel better about your skills, seeing how bad they are.)

content:
Posted: September 14, 2014
												"Natural selection is the gradual process by which biological traits become either more or less common in a population as a function of the effect of inherited traits on the differential reproductive success of organisms interacting with their environment. It is a key mechanism of evolution. The term "natural selection" was popularized by Charles Darwin, who intended it to be compared with artificial selection, now more commonly referred to as selective breeding.Variation exists within all populations of organisms. This occurs partly because random mutations occur in the genome of an individual organism, and these mutations can be passed to offspring. Throughout the individuals’ lives, their genomes interact with their environments to cause variations in traits. (The environment of a genome includes the molecular biology in the cell, other cells, other individuals, populations, species, as well as the abiotic environment.) Individuals with certain variants of the trait may survive and reproduce more than individuals with other, less successful, variants. Therefore the population evolves. Factors that affect reproductive success are also important, an issue that Charles Darwin developed in his ideas on sexual selection, for example.Natural selection acts on the phenotype, or the observable characteristics of an organism, but the genetic (heritable) basis of any phenotype that gives a reproductive advantage may become more common in a population (see allele frequency). Over time, this process can result in populations that specialize for particular ecological niches and may eventually result in the emergence of new species. In other words, natural selection is an important process (though not the only process) by which evolution takes place within a population of organisms. Natural selection can be contrasted with artificial selection, in which humans intentionally choose specific traits (although they may not always get what they want). In natural selection there is no intentional choice. In other words, artificial selection is teleological and natural selection is not teleological.Natural selection is one of the cornerstones of modern biology. The term was introduced by Darwin in his influential 1859 book On the Origin of Species,[1] in which natural selection was described as analogous to artificial selection, a process by which animals and plants with traits considered desirable by human breeders are systematically favored for reproduction. The concept of natural selection was originally developed in the absence of a valid theory of heredity; at the time of Darwin's writing, nothing was known of modern genetics. The union of traditional Darwinian evolution with subsequent discoveries in classical and molecular genetics is termed the modern evolutionary synthesis. Natural selection remains the primary explanation for adaptive evolution." - Wikipedia

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												Always a game to be had and weekly updates.  This is one of my games that any time day or night I can go to and find a game.  While it can be frustrating to learn the community is usually pretty helpful to newbies, particularly if you play on the rookie/rookie friendly servers.  The learning curb is a little steep but this is greatly helped by in game viewable tuturials.  I highly suggest you watch videos on how to command in youtube seperately though before you consider trying to command youself.  And when you do in general it's best that you wait until a time when no one else wants to command and then you can pipe up on mic that you'd like to give it a shot that you've done your homework.  It's usually best if you wait until you lose your rookie status which takes awhile unless you are putting some serious playtime in.The two teams couldn't be more different both to command and to play, which really lends to the emmersion.  Although if you have a choice you're probably better off playing as marines especially if you haven't checked out the tuturial videos which I highly recommend especially playing as one of the various alient types.  There is a very active workshop community which you can make use of to get various helpful mods or cosmetic ones if you want to spice things up for yourself.   This is well worth the price of admission as the game shows no signs of going dead anytime soon.  If I were to complain about anything it would be that the balance sometimes favors one side or another but as I said they come out with updates every week so if something is noticed as being too OP they will usually fix it.  My only other gripe is that sometimes I log in and there are 3-7 servers going that I usually like to play on and they are all full so I might have to spend 15-30 minutes in a low popped server until it builds up into a proper game.  Most servers are full at 18-22 give or take a few, but there are a few servers that use enlargened maps with max players set to 50 or more, although those only really get popped during peak hours usually.The action can be quite intense even in pub games and it's not uncommon for people to get excited, if anyone ever gives you any grief just say your new and if you don't know what you did wrong ask what you could have done better.  Almost everyone uses their Mic btw, especially if they are commanding.  If you've always wanted to play Aliens online but weren't in the scene when the last good aliens multiplayer games were out (lets face it they all mostly sucked) then this is your game.  You will not go bored here and the incredible amount of detail in every map will keep giving new discoveries for ambush points or ventilation access.   Stick in groups so you can better watch eachothers backs as an attack can come from anywhere above or below.  Aim steady and true or the aliens are gonna eat ya!

content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												A thinkin' mans/w FPS & RTS combined like Alien vs Predator meets Starcraft. NS1(HL mod) was my all time fav and NS2 is it on steroids! A seasoned loyal community who are helpful & welcoming to new comers usually. There is a steep learning curve to NS so patience, humility & respect goes a long way when it comes to gameplay, the veterans will reward you and assist you if you display these qualities on pubs . The developers have always been well tied to the community and for 10 bucks you won't be disappointed.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												If you are looking for a new fps and want depth to your gameplay... look no more. NS2 offers a unique, high quality, emersive experience with purpose. This game is not a meat grinder or a ping war.  Skill and adaptation are your tools for success. The graphics are beautiful, the controls feel solid and precise, and the battles are amazing. Servers are large with some hosting beyond 40 people. This game seems to have it all. I will not go in depth of what it does have but I can tell you there has been nothing about this game to warrant any kind of negative review.Even as a new player the game is super fun and you will not be taken advantage of unless you just run around randomly, alone. (in that case you deserve to die as in any fps)NS2 does have a learning curve but it is at your pace. You do not need to command the chair unless you want to, etc.Grab some friends, watch some videos then start hunting. Your team will help you. Your commander will tell you to build stuff. Pay attention to voice chat.  I can almost guarantee you will have had a great time at the end of your first full match.9.5/10- counted approximatly 200 people online on a Friday 11:00 am Central

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												One of those rare perfect games with fun gameplay and required skill. This game will have you thrashing you mouse while holding the fire button hoping you get the last hit you need, And when you get it? It feels great. One of the best games I've ever played. you play and play and as you get better you realize, instead of rewarding you with OP weapons or unlocks. the only thing you get is your knowledge. As you slowly get more and more kills a life you see that this game has made you better at firstperson-shooters, A faster thinker, and a better person.Community: Plus the fact that you have to play for long periods of time to be good means that all of the little kids and their tiny attention spans disappear or cease to be visible from the community. MEANING that there are no kids, just fun, chill, Team playing Adults wanting only a good time. I have not met one "12-year-old-living-breathing-cancer" While I've played this. The community is nice and will let you in with open arms.Commander/RTS:The Firstperson element blends perfectly with the Commander element which lets you command your team as if it were an RTS. Because the community is cool, they actually listin, even though your a nobody in a chair telling them what to do. And if you lose? Just say "Sorry guys I'm a noob, its my first time." And the team you just drove into the ground will be patting you on the back giving you tips for the near future. You think I knew what I was doing first game? Hell no, but it lasted an hour and when we lost, the enemy commander said "That was fun, you are fun" and i almost cried. I mean i pushed locker for the whole game and they ♥♥♥♥ed my main and i didn't notice but still. it was fun. DLC:The DLC is a great addition and is worth 6 bucks. (Its $6 for each) I plan to buy moreWorkshop:The community is somewhat strong with new weapons, mods, balances textures, modles, sounds, and some truly Dank Content. Like the Faded mod, which turns this action packed si-fi shooter into a suspenseful team horror shooter. Or human V human games. In case the Aliens get to boring. (Like aliens will ever get boring)Dev team:Development of the game is still strong, adding new elements and bug fixes all the time. And with their new "Bootcamp" update. Now is the best time for newcomers. They also just improved hit boxes so the game is at an all time high. Preformance:I have an Acer. Which isn't exactly the best Gaming PC. With Inagrated HD Graphics and 4 gigs of RAM there aren't many games this brick can run.  But God Damn, This♥♥♥♥♥♥works. And it works great, I play the at locked 30 fps, sometimes if the gods are feeling kind i get 40-50fps. So if your worried about your requirements. The fact that you loaded this review up mean you'll prolly be fine. The load times are a bit long but that could just be the Acer. (Acer explore beyond limits am I right?)Overall:I Can't stress this enough. This is a wonderful game that every PC should have installed. Now i don't do number grades but you can read this reveiw and grade the game based off of my reveiw. OR you could play it...

content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												So the first major problem with this game is nobody plays.  Nobody.  There's like 3 or 4 full servers, and all of them are people who have been playing since the beta/preorder.  I never saw a single new player ever.  The second problem is aimbots run rampant in this game.  Aliens were always losing because everyone would play with aimbots an try to join marines.  The game devs fix was to buff aliens and give the assault rifle less accuracy (bullets don't hit where you aim).  So now what happens is anyone who plays without an aimbot gets♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and anyone who plays with one 100-0's aliens moving at full speed from across entire rooms in less then half a second.  Could of been a really good game, but the player community ♥♥♥♥♥ all over it with rampant aim bot use, and the game devs don't intend to ever actually fix it.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												I'll start off by admitting that I only played as Commander once, so I don't know if I missed out on a huge part of the game. Maybe I did, but I didn't want to disappoint my tem with my bad commanding- some Single Player maps might have been good so people can learn the ropes. That said, the mulltiplayer FPS is awesome. You start off not knowing anything, so people yell at you and you die. Just like other multiplayer shooters, I guess! As a Marine, you go out there and shoot aliens. If you shoot enough (and your Commander has researched them), you can get bigger and better guns, jetpacks, mechs, etc. Jetpack + grenade launcher is my favorite, though I'm not sure it's too good at killing aliens.As an alien, you kill people until you can evolve into fancier aliens. Aliens that can fly, heal/build, do weird assassin stuff, or just be big and smashy. Aliens can also buy the ability to go invisible, which is pretty nifty.Maps can sometimes go on forever since the 'losing' team can't be finished off. But it's still loads of fun either attacking the final base or defending it.So... FPS: 10/10RTS: I didn't play/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												The game itself is fun but some maps can wreck the balance in favor of the alien team. And many maps feature a single key room that whoever controls it is guaranteed a victory.The addictive aspect of the game is the exosuit/jp/flamethrower due to the fact that you cannot have them always, but sometimes the game just drags when you can't get them no matter how hard you fight, or lose them almost instantly due to how nerfed their abilities are. Even worse, you require a good 80-90% of map control to afford them for strategic pushes, which never happens because the alien team will almost always surrender long before that can occur, or people buy there upgrades out of sync and die alone. It’s sad really because the heavy-“train”/jetpack pushes were a mainstay element of NS1.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												I think this game has a chance to be good, but it does lack in content and things to do. Have to say the game is fun for 2 hours or so, after that the gameplay becomes repetitive and you sort of loose interest in the game. The servers never have any players on them. It seems that not a lot of people play this game anymore. I remember this game from a really long time ago and it was on my wishlist for a long time, after finally remembering to buy the game, I was seriously disappointed. Also wish that more people would have microphones, without them the game is just plain sounds and people doing things on their own without requesting for help from fellow teammates. This game could've been awesome.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 31, 2016
												I want to recommend this game because the concept behind it has (as far as I can tell) never been done. It's a mix of an FPS and a top down perspective strategy game. Just imagine its starcraft, except your units are little f*ckers that dont listen. All jokes aside the game has great potential and is loads of fun. There are some glaring issues with the game such as balance and optimization. The game runs horribly, I lucked out my first time playing and got 25 frames per second (I pinkie promise my rig is pretty good). Some of the weapons on the marines side are pretty rediculous. If you combo together a jetpack and a grenade launcher you are unstopable, however the mech suit dies in 10 or so hits and overheats near instantly. I would only recommend this game to those who hold a extreme intrest in this game, but other than that there are better games out there.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												The experience on Linux so far:EDIT: still not playable on nvidia 346.47, still crashes immediately on start.- Slow frame rate.- Bad network code. (even with low latency, it just doesn't cut it for a modern game)- Buggy. Sometimes updates fixes bugs, sometimes updates have new bugs.- As of nvidia 334.21 the game does not render, only a black screen. I.e not playable.- Still not playable on nvidia 337.12, crashes on start.The game:FPS and RTS (for one player) in combination. High paced and very tactical. I suggest getting a mic or practice those typing skills for fast updates in team strategy and tactics. The game itself is very unforgiving when it comes to new players. The first 300 hours of gameplay is punishing, in particular when you face off against seasoned players. The game also has an RTS element for one player who is the "commander", although it adds very little to the game. The network code is some of the worst I've seen in FPS gaming. Since I bought the game there has been over a dozen updates, each one fixes one bug and introduces two more. Fun for a while. As of now the game doesn't even start.Score:0/5

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
												For me an exciting new game meant a showcase of engine technology, pushing PC hardware, further and further and really showing off to your friends how amazing new software is. Well now that we live in the age of copy and paste, games such as Natural Selection 2 often go overlooked. No this game doesn't feel like counter-strike, it isn't on the source engine, you are going to be out of your comfort zone. This game understands development from the ground up. Don't just force your square game idea into the round peg game engine you just licensed. This game needs to be celebrated despite if you are a fan of it or not. One of the last examples of old school game philosophy, love of the games.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 16, 2016
												I think this is one of the best games ever made. Brilliant strategic and tactical depth. Awesome graphics with perfect styling. Runs pretty good as long as the server isn't a toaster. Being competitively balanced it can lead to a few lopsided games for every balanced one you get, but when you get a balanced game it's a real trip and even better if you win. The marines struggle to stay alive, the way the alien creep spreads over the map and the lighting effects have to be experienced. It takes some effort to learn all the nuances (and you might not ever get it all) but that's what makes it good, definitely worth 10 bucks. Since there is nothing else like this game that competes, it will always have a player base, some of the NS2 players play nothing but NS2. Vets 99% of the time never have a problem helping new players but you got to be able to listen.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												The best multiplayer game on Steam, hands down. The fast-paced action of Team Fortress 2, the requirement for strong communication and teamwork of Dota 2, more involved tactical thinking than the Battlefield games and a strategy element that approaches Starcraft 2 in terms of build possibilities and asymmetrical balance.I still play Counterstrike sometimes when I want to mindlessly shoot at people but if you want a game that requires true tactical and strategic thought as well as has a very high skill ceiling you can grow into, there's nothing better.The game isn't very newbie-friendly but if you stick with it you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2013
												On upon a Chicken, not long ago, there was a unicorn that loved Flayra. One day, the time was 3:11 and that was time for Gorge(the unicorn's name) to catch Flayra. She uses her invisible Flayra net. Gorge hired 3 of her friends: Lerk the Lerk, Onos the Onos and Fade the Fade. After a tiring 12 minutes of pre-caching this game during loadtime, Flayra was never caught, but he used all the money he gained from this game to fund his Ocean game that nobody cares about.Flayra was happy, but the Chicken was not smelling like the burnt oven cleaner that he intended. There were exactly zero fumes during the room and he had no human parents. The Egg flew around space to find the Chicken, and Planet Earth died.Then finally, after a long journey the Egg managed to say her last few words: "Don't buy this game... it will be cause your Wallet's lifecycle to end".

content:

												This is what Aliens vs. Predator should have been. It's a fast-paced shooter fps/strategy, multiplayer only. You can be humans with different weapons or aliens with different classes, while a commander for each team is volunteered to build the bases and get more resources with the help of the team who is in first-person. The game has a learning curve but it's quite satisfying to play, and is also quite polished. No reason to not play if you like some fun multiplayer action.

content:
Posted: March 25, 2013
												Highy recommended during Steam's WEEKEND DEAL!! You really cannot do anything wrong by purchasing it for just and only 11,50€.Teamwork is everything, Rambos will never have a chance (to win alone) inside this Team-Deathmatch based gameplay.This game (officially) combines NATURAL SELECTION 2 with StarCraft and Counter-Strike. Let me also add the series: Dead Space MP, Left 4 Dead, Team Fortress, Battlezone, ....All these elements are included, simply amazing and fun. It is also Rooky-friendly for newbies and beginners, so it officially has Rooky-friendly Servers up to hardcore and modded modes.As a Commander play in a RTS-style environment and give your human-controlled Soldiers orders as to build up structures, follow waypoints and hold and defense critical lines. So, collect Ressources to upgrade Technology centers, build up Armories, Teleports, Sentries and an other bunch of structures.Don't want to be a Commander anymore? Simply leave the Command Station and fight with your friends side by side within the 1st-person-perspective. Ask your Commander for support as for ammo, health, shields, weapons and waypoints and heck... Upgrades!!Aliens have to infest areas in order to place structures. I see it much more easier to command the Aliens. Yet as a newbie I can say, it is nicely balanced. Some maps are just too big tho. There are maps these could be better for 20 vs 20 players.Amazing graphics, weapons, effects, ambients, nicely built maps and even the music is movie-like. I see a mega potential for this game for its future. Map Editor is included so NATURAL SELECTION 2 becomes highly modable. This game will never die as Left 4 Dead won't die.6 hours left guys. If you don't buy it now, so you have to wait for a next Steam Sale or buy it later. NATURAL SELECTION 2 is a must-have for RTS fans in a Sci-Fi world and for these who have fun to use team-based tactics. Don't ignore the all-seeing Commander.Did I forget anything?xD..oooh, NATURAL SELECTION 2 has been VAC-secured!!! Have fun, Good Luck, Commander!BEST REGARDS- N3
